page.title: 06Mrs.Lomas-Changing Times
page.content: Mrs. Lomas' family have farmed in the Cumwhinton area for 150 years. The farmhouse that she lives in was built in the year 1600. Mrs. Lomas is 72 years old and attended Cumwhinton School.She recalls that not too long ago the cows were milked by hand , the land worked by horses and the milk was taken away in churns. Now there are milking machines ,tractors do all the work and the milk is collected by bulk tankers. Like many of the Cumbrian farms of the past her farm is very small by present standards, only 52 acres. Most of the farms in this part of the country were between 50 and 100 acres but now there are fewer though larger units. Mrs.Lomas spends her leisure time at flower shows, cattle markets and watching television programmes about farming.
